comment_data.body: I think that final whitespace is intentional...
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1013,9 +1013,9 @@ describe('ui/builtin messages', function()
     -- ignore final whitespace inside string
     -- luacheck: push ignore
     eq([[--- Syntax items ---
-vimComment     xxx match /\s"[^\-:.%#=*].*$/ms=s+1,lc=1  excludenl contains=@vimCommentGroup,vimCommentString 
-                   match /\<endif\s\+".*$/ms=s+5,lc=5  contains=@vimCommentGroup,vimCommentString 
-                   match /\<else\s\+".*$/ms=s+4,lc=4  contains=@vimCommentGroup,vimCommentString 
+vimComment     xxx match /\s"[^\-:.%#=*].*$/ms=s+1,lc=1  excludenl contains=@vimCommentGroup,vimCommentString
+                   match /\<endif\s\+".*$/ms=s+5,lc=5  contains=@vimCommentGroup,vimCommentString
+                   match /\<else\s\+".*$/ms=s+4,lc=4  contains=@vimCommentGroup,vimCommentString

comment_data.body: `'ambiwidth'` is a global option so `scope='global'` is not needed.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1403,9 +1403,9 @@ describe('TUI', function()
       {3:-- TERMINAL --}                                    |
     ]]
     screen:expect(singlewidth_screen, attrs)
-    child_session:request('nvim_set_option', 'ambiwidth', 'double')
+    child_session:request('nvim_set_option_value', 'ambiwidth', 'double', {scope='global'})
     screen:expect(doublewidth_screen, attrs)
-    child_session:request('nvim_set_option', 'ambiwidth', 'single')
+    child_session:request('nvim_set_option_value', 'ambiwidth', 'single', {scope='global'})

@@ -383,8 +383,8 @@ describe("'scrollback' option", function()
 
   local function set_fake_shell()
     -- shell-test.c is a fake shell that prints its arguments and exits.
-    nvim('set_option', 'shell', testprg('shell-test'))
-    nvim('set_option', 'shellcmdflag', 'EXE')
+    nvim('set_option_value', 'shell', testprg('shell-test'), {scope='global'})
+    nvim('set_option_value', 'shellcmdflag', 'EXE', {scope='global'})

comment_data.body: if possible, ideally this would live in `api/deprecated.c`

comment_regular_data.body: IIRC `nvim_win_set_option` cannot be replaced with `nvim_set_option_value`. This has been mentioned in some issue.
That is configurable with the `scope` argument, and thus not a problem.

That issue was wrong, see my comments. `nvim_win_set_option` sets the non-local option so is replaceable with `nvim_set_option_value` without `scope` being provided. `scope` is needed to match the behaviour of `setlocal`.
I changed everything in runtime. Didn't check the tests though.
Yes, I saw that, and I don't think you missed any in runtime; I was specifically referring to the tests.
That was hard. Automated a fair bit of it. And I think there's actually a bug in the new functions.

`nvim_get_option_value` has some subtle differences to `nvim_[buf_|win_]get_option` due to it having a very different implementation. I'm currently working on fixing this so it uses the same implementation. So this might take a bit more work but it should bring some perf improvements for free.

> That issue was wrong, see my comments. nvim_win_set_option sets the non-local option so is replaceable with nvim_set_option_value without scope being provided. scope is needed to match the behaviour of setlocal.

@lewis6991 Just to clarify, https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/20045 says at the top that it was written for Neovim 0.7.0, whose version of `nvim_set_option_value` did not support `win` or `buf`, so it could not replace `nvim_[buf|win]_set_option`. That issue is correct for the version of Neovim for which it was written.
